about-content-one.description: One of three paragraphs describing the Santa Tracker website. Tone should be whimsical. The Dashboard will be a google map with information displayed on top, like the name of the city he's in, the number of presents delivered, the current temperature, etc.
about-content-one.message: On Christmas Eve we’ll be proudly showcasing a Santa’s dashboard, the technology that powers his sleigh during his around-the-world journey. We’ve received this special preview from one of Santa’s many developer elves, who are hard at work in the North Pole helping Santa prepare for his big day. Santa’s dashboard - featuring the latest and greatest in Google Maps technology and sleigh engineering - will allow you to follow his progress around the world, and also learn a little about some of his stops along the way.

about-content-three.description: One of three paragraphs describing the Santa Tracker website. Tone should be light, but direct, as it links people to more help.
about-content-three.raw: The Google Maps Santa Tracker is created and developed by Google, with a little help from Santa’s elves. Need help or have another question? Visit our <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="//support.google.com/santatracker"></ph>Help Center<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>.

about-content-two.description: One of three paragraphs describing the Santa Tracker website. Tone should be whimsical. The Village is the main navigation for Santa Tracker.
about-content-two.message: Our friendly elves have also invited you to explore Santa’s village while Santa gets ready for his journey. So go ahead and explore his village, you might just find some fun activities and meet some interesting elves.

about-santa.description: Link text. Please keep this short. Links to the Santa Tracker About page. Page supplies more info about the project.

about_title.message: Welcome to the Google Maps Santa Tracker!

ar_tradition.message: In Argentina, Christmas begins promptly at midnight. Many families kick off the holiday by hosting festive celebrations in their homes, opening gifts with their loved ones, and lighting fireworks in the early hours of the morning.

au_tradition.message: Australia's Southern Hemisphere location means it's summer time in December. Instead of sleigh bells and cocoa, many Australians head to the beach to celebrate the holidays with a prawn lunch and a few rounds of cricket.

ca_tradition.message: Canadian children usually celebrate a snowy, white Christmas. They bundle up in their scarves and toques, a Canadian woolen hat, to play in the snow, ice-skate, and toboggan! On Christmas Eve, they leave milk and cookies by the fireplace for Santa (and sometimes a carrot for his reindeer).

codeboogie-result-missing-block-success.description: Short hint on how the puzzle can be improved even if level is complete. One or two sentences max. Refers to blocks visually displayed below. Has a token for a dynamic number between 2-6, the token can be skipped and translation worded that fewer blocks are needed.
codeboogie-result-missing-block-success.message: Did you know you can finish this dance with just {{ideal}} blocks? Try using the block below.

codeboogie-result-perfect-success.description: Short message after completing a level. One or two sentences max.
codeboogie-result-perfect-success.message: Nice moves! You finished the dance perfectly.

codeboogie-result-too-few-blocks-fail.description: Short hint after failing a level. One or two sentences max.
codeboogie-result-too-few-blocks-fail.message: You are using the right blocks, but try using more of them to complete the dance.

codeboogie-result-too-many-blocks-succes.description: Short hint on how the puzzle can be improved even if level is complete. One or two sentences max. Has a token for a dynamic number between 2-6, the token can be skipped and translation worded that fewer blocks are needed.
codeboogie-result-too-many-blocks-succes.message: Did you know you can finish this dance with just {{ideal}} blocks?

codeboogie-result-too-many-steps.description: Short hint indicating that the coded dance was too long.

codelab-block-repeat.description: Code block label. 15char limit. Is followed by a editable number and another label like this "repeat 5 times". Sadly the labels can't be reordered for technical reasons.

codelab-block-repeat-tooltip.description: Tooltip for code block which repeats one or more statements.

codelab-block-whenrun.description: Code block label. 15char limit. Start of the code, reads to indicate that blocks below it will execute in order

codelab-result-too-many-blocks-success.raw: Did you know you can finish this level with just <ph name="IDEAL"><ex>4</ex>{{ideal}}</ph> blocks?

elvish_language_name.description: Localised name of a fake language. Appears in a translation drop down.

en_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

endofjourneymessage.message: Santa's finished his journey for the year! He and the elves are still having some fun in the North Pole before their annual vacation.

er_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

error.description: Shown on the error page, if anything went wrong. Short and non-specific.
error.message: There was a problem, but Santa's Elves are looking into it.

error-lost-connection.description: Paragraph text that appears on our error page. The error might appear if the user is offline or there is a problem with Google's servers. Text should be non-specific and light hearted.
error-lost-connection.message: Looks like we just lost our connection with the North Pole. Santa's elves are working hard to fix it - stay tuned!

error-not-found.description: Paragraph text that appears on an error page if something can't be found, with a link back to Santa's Village. Text should be non-specific and light hearted.
error-not-found.raw: Oh no, Santa's Elves can't find this page! You might have better luck if you head back to <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="./"></ph>Santa's Village<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>.

error-internal.description: Paragraph text that appears on an error page if the site encountered an error, with a link back to Santa's Village. Text should be non-specific and light hearted.
error-internal.raw: Oh no, there was a problem! We've informed Santa's Elves, but try heading back to <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="./"></ph>Santa's Village<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>.

error-out-of-date.description: A short error message saying that Santa Tracker is out of date and that the user should reload.
error-out-of-date.message: This is an outdated version of Santa's Village! Try opening Santa Tracker again to see the latest version.

error-try-again.description: Link text. Please keep this short. Link appears on an error page. Clicking the link will reload the application.

error-unsupported.description: Paragraph informing user that they're using a fallback version of Santa Tracker, and that they'd have a better time with a different browser. This fallback version has a limited number of games but doesn't support tracking Santa on the 24th of December (on a map)
error-unsupported.message: Santa Tracker doesn't support your browser. To play more games and to track Santa on the 24th of December, try your phone or a different browser.

es_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

et_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

explore.description: Button text. 15char limit. A label on an activity that will let the user explore a scene.

explore-village.description: Button text. Allows users to return to Santa's Village.

familyguide_title.message: Holiday fun for the whole family

familyguide_body.description: Body text of an information page.
familyguide_body.message: Santa’s Village is the perfect place for families to celebrate the season. You’ll find all your favorite characters together with fun, educational and interactive activities for every age.

familyguide_secondary_title.description: Title of a section. This appears on an information page.
familyguide_secondary_title.message: Track Santa on the big day

familyguide_secondary_body.description: Body text of a section. This appears on an information page.
familyguide_secondary_body.message: On December 24th Santa’s Village transforms into a tracking experience where you can follow Santa and his reindeer as they deliver presents to kids around the world.

familyguide_secondary_cta_01.description: Call to action label. This appears on an information page.
familyguide_secondary_cta_01.message: Follow along on the Santa Tracker website or Android app

familyguide_secondary_cta_02.description: Call to action label. This appears on an information page.
familyguide_secondary_cta_02.message: Psst! Did you know, Santa's journey lasts 25 hours?! He makes his first stop just after 10 PM local time in far eastern Russia, when it’s 5 AM in New York and 11 AM in Paris.

familyguide_nav_link_01.description: Nav label. This appears on an information page.

familyguide_nav_link_02.description: Nav label. This appears on an information page.

familyguide_nav_link_03.description: Nav label. This appears on an information page.

familyguide_nav_link_04.description: Nav label. This appears on an information page.

familyguide_nav_link_05.description: Nav label. This appears on an information page.

familyguide_nav_link_06.description: Nav label. This appears on an information page.

familyguide_nav_link_07.description: Nav label. This appears on an information page and refers to the Google Assistant.

familyguide_accordion_title.description: Title of a section in an information page.

familyguide_group_01_title.description: Title of a card group in an information page.
familyguide_group_01_title.message: Learn to code with Santa’s Elves

familyguide_group_01_body.description: Description of a card group in an information page.
familyguide_group_01_body.message: The elves are always working on their coding skills. Explore games that will teach you the basics. Anyone can try their hand at coding!

familyguide_group_02_title.description: Title of a card group in an information page.

familyguide_group_02_body.description: Description of a card group in an information page.
familyguide_group_02_body.message: The holidays can look quite different from place to place. Learn how the world celebrates the season with games and quizzes galore.

familyguide_group_03_title.description: Title of a card group in an information page.

familyguide_group_03_body.description: Description of a card group in an information page.
familyguide_group_03_body.message: Santa’s Village thrives on the magic of making. Discover games that let you draw, paint, build and create with all your favorite characters.

familyguide_group_04_title.description: Title of a card group in an information page.

familyguide_group_04_body.description: Description of a card group in an information page.
familyguide_group_04_body.message: Grab the popcorn and snuggle in under a cozy blanket. You can catch the whole gang on the big screen at the Village theater or read along an interactive storybook as Ollie the Narwhal celebrates the season under the sea.

familyguide_card_age.description: Age label of cards in an information page.

familyguide_card_01_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_01_body.message: Use coding fundamentals to navigate the elf through the forest to find dropped presents.

familyguide_card_02_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_02_body.message: Create your own holiday card by programming your own snowflake—just select one of many backgrounds, and share it with your friends.

familyguide_card_03_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_03_body.message: The elves are back to coding practice, while mixing in their dancing skills. Use code to choreograph the elves' dances - but watch out, as you get better, the dances get harder!

familyguide_card_04_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_04_body.message: From wearing a toque in Canada to sporting swim trunks in Australia, click the map pins to learn about holiday traditions around the globe.

familyguide_card_05_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_05_body.message: From Happy New Year in Elvish to Дед Мороз, learn the seasonal lingo from around the world.

familyguide_card_06_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_06_body.message: Santa's got a lot of places to go. Match the outline of a country to the map in this geography game.

familyguide_card_07_title.description: Title of a card in an information page.

familyguide_card_07_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_07_body.message: Do you know your holiday history? Show your stuff in a nine question quiz that’s sure to test your trivia skills.

familyguide_card_08_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_08_body.message: Hungry? Discover delicacies from around the world and explore food from countries near and far.

familyguide_card_09_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_09_body.message: Tap into Santa's very own creative suite. Each tool, brush, and sticker has a custom sound, making this an audio and visual experience.

familyguide_card_10_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_10_body.message: Experiment and play in your own wintery sandbox. Use 3D materials to build anything: houses, toys, snowpeople, forests, or anything else you can dream up.

familyguide_card_11_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_11_body.message: Build your own elf from head to toe and make sure it looks elftastic for the many holiday soirées happening on the North Pole.

familyguide_card_12_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_12_body.message: Santa is in the barbershop and he needs help getting a whole new ‘do. Color his beard, blow dry his hair, add some decorations or shave it all off with the clippers.

familyguide_card_13_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_13_body.message: Join the elves, reindeer, Santa and Mrs. Claus on a visit to the Museum of Holiday Cheer!

familyguide_card_14_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_14_body.message: There's many an elf, reindeer, and pegman to shuttle around the North Pole. Watch how they navigate from place to place.

familyguide_card_15_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_15_body.message: Santa and the reindeer are ready to go but they need a little help from the coding elves before take off.

familyguide_card_16_body.description: Description of a card in an information page.
familyguide_card_16_body.message: Our Village friends join Ollie the narwhal for a day underwater as they put together the first annual kelp lighting celebration.

familyguide_tips_title.description: Title of a section in an information page.

familyguide_tips_body.description: Description of a section in an information page.
familyguide_tips_body.message: Get more magic out of Santa Tracker this season with all your favorite Google products.

familyguide_tips_tip01_title.description: Title of the first tip. This appears in an information page.
familyguide_tips_tip01_title.message: "Hey Google, what’s new at the North Pole?"

familyguide_tips_tip01_body.description: Description of the first tip. This appears in an information page. 'Dimplesticks' is the name of an Elf, and it will not be translated (transliteration is fine).
familyguide_tips_tip01_body.message: Ask the Google Assistant every day for fun updates from Dimplesticks the Elf.

familyguide_tips_tip02_title.description: Title of the second tip. This appears in an information page.

familyguide_tips_tip02_body.description: Description of the second tip. This appears in an information page.
familyguide_tips_tip02_body.message: Download the Santa Tracker App for Android on the Play Store. There’s an exclusive Village scene with games you’ll only find in the app.

familyguide_tips_tip03_title.description: Title of the third tip. This appears in an information page.

familyguide_tips_tip03_body.description: Description of the third tip. This appears in an information page.
familyguide_tips_tip03_body.message: Track Santa from your wrist with Android Wear integration.

familyguide_tips_tip04_title.description: Title of the fourth tip. This appears in an information page.
familyguide_tips_tip04_title.message: Bring Santa to your living room

familyguide_tips_tip04_body.description: Description of the fourth tip. This appears in an information page.
familyguide_tips_tip04_body.message: Search for "Santa" on Google to see Santa in 3D. On most iPhones and some advanced Android devices, you can see him in AR, waving right through your camera!

familyguide_tips_tip05_title.description: Title of the fifth tip. This appears in an information page.

familyguide_tips_tip05_body.description: Description of the fifth tip. This appears in an information page.
familyguide_tips_tip05_body.message: Bring some holiday fun to your messages. Find Santa themed gifs and stickers by searching for “Santa Tracker gifs” (English only) on Google’s Tenor page.

familyguide_assistant_title.description: Title of a section heading in an information page. 'North Pole Minute' is a name of a fictional news service provided by Santa.
familyguide_assistant_title.message: Never Miss a North Pole Minute

familyguide_assistant_body_01.description: Body text of a section heading in an information page.
familyguide_assistant_body_01.message: Use the Google Assistant to find out more about Santa Claus during December! This integration is available in select languages.

familyguide_assistant_body_02.description: Body text describing a child's use of the Google Assistant with a Family Link account. 'Family Link' is translated, please see the related link in your local language.
familyguide_assistant_body_02.raw: With their parent's permission, children under 13 can also have their own personalized Google Assistant experience when they log in with their own account, managed with <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://families.google.com/familylink/" target="_blank"></ph>Family Link<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>.

familyguide_assistant_card01_title.description: Title of a card in an information page that tells users they can talk to Santa Claus.

familyguide_assistant_card01_body.description: Body text of a card in an information page.
familyguide_assistant_card01_body.message: Google Assistant connects you with the North Pole, where Santa is busy rehearsing for a musical concert. He only knows one song—can you help him figure out the best way to play it?

familyguide_assistant_card02_title.description: Title of a card in an information page. Refers to a fictionalized news program that runs on a channel provided by Santa.

familyguide_assistant_card02_body.description: Body text of a card in an information page.
familyguide_assistant_card02_body.message: Tune in daily to the North Pole Newscast to find out what Santa and his elves are up to. Just ask the Google Assistant what's new at the North Pole.

familyguide_assistant_card03_title.description: Title of a card in an information page, refering to an activity you can open on the Google Assistant.

familyguide_assistant_card03_body.description: Body text of a card in an information page.
familyguide_assistant_card03_body.message: When Santa's not busy with the elves at the workshop, he spends time sharpening up his comedy skills. Just ask the Google Assistant for a Santa joke to hear his routine.

familyguide_doublecard_title.description: Title of a section heading in an information page.

familyguide_doublecard_body.description: Description of a section heading in an information page.
familyguide_doublecard_body.message: After all the eggnog is gone and the presents are through, discover year-round resources for family fun with Google.

familyguide_doublecard_card01_title.description: Title of a card in an information page

familyguide_doublecard_card01_body.description: Body text of a card in an information page
familyguide_doublecard_card01_body.message: We all want a healthy planet for today and tomorrow. Learn simple tips from Google to help people and the planet thrive together.

familyguide_doublecard_card02_title.description: Title of a card in an information page

familyguide_doublecard_card02_body.description: Body text of a card in an information page
familyguide_doublecard_card02_body.message: To make the most of the Internet, kids need to be prepared to make smart decisions. Be Internet Awesome teaches kids the fundamentals of digital citizenship and safety so they can explore the online world with confidence.

familylink.description: Notice about using Google Assistant via a child's account configured with Google's Family Link product
familylink.message: Add your kid's Google account, managed with Family Link

featured.description: Label indicating that a game is featured today.

fi_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

fi_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
fi_tradition.message: Finnish people believe that Father Christmas, "Joulupukki", lives in the northern part of the country - Korvatunturi, to be exact. If you visit, you might find his secret workshop, where gnomes are hard at work. Or you might find reindeer roaming in pine tree forests.

finished-text.description: Paragraph text that appears as the sole text on a landing page. This page is displayed when the Santa Tracker is not active.
finished-text.message: Happy Holidays! Santa has completed his journey around the world and is taking a much deserved break. Visit us again next year!

fr_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

fr_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

fr_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
fr_tradition.message: In France, children traditionally put their shoes out next to the fireplace in anticipation of Père Noël's arrival. If children have been good throughout the year, Père Noël will fill the shoes with gifts.

fullscreen.description: Label for a button which makes the site fullscreen. Short, but no limit.

ga_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

gameover.description: Appears when the player is game over. Very large font, keep as short as possible.

gameover_level.description: Label during game over for which level was reached.

gameover_score.description: Label during game over for how much score the player got.

getgooglemaps.description: Describes using the Google Maps product to find Santa.

getready.description: Label that informs a user that a game is about to start, and that they should prepare.

gh_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

gh_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
gh_tradition.message: Christmas in Ghana includes the whole family. Adults dress up in costumes and hand out candy and sweets around the neighborhood. Children decorate their homes with paper ornaments and drawings they make at school.

gotovillage.description: A link to Santa's Village. One method of site navigation.

gr_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

gr_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
gr_tradition.message: In Greece, friendly but troublesome creatures called 'kallikántzari' live most of the year in the center of the earth. But at Christmas, they love to hide in people's houses, frightening people, playing tricks, or devouring Christmas foods. Greeks perform rituals to keep these hobgoblins away.

gt_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

gt_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
gt_tradition.message: Guatemalans celebrate Christmas with fun and dancing. They wear hats called Puritina, eat Guatemalan style tamales, light firecrackers at midnight, and dance the night away with various styles of dancing.

is_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

is_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
is_tradition.message: At Christmas time in Iceland, families give gifts of warm clothing to each member of their household. According to legend, there is a frightening Christmas Cat who gobbles up anyone not equipped for the cold and wintery weather. Families work together to ensure nobody will 'go to the Christmas Cat.'

it_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

it_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

ja_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

kg_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

kg_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
kg_tradition.message: In Kyrgyzstan, Ayaz Ata (Grandfather Frost) comes at midnight on New Year's Eve and leaves presents under the New Year tree. When the clock strikes midnight, families throughout the country light fireworks to celebrate this beautiful occasion. The cities become as bright as day.

ko_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

kr_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

kr_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
kr_tradition.message: In South Korea, Christmas is a national holiday. It's also known for being a romantic holiday. Many couples go on dates in the city, where streets and stores are trimmed with dazzling lights.

la_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

light.description: Link text. This is in reference to Christmas lights.

lightdescription.description: Describes what happens when you click the 'light up' link
lightdescription.message: Light up your TV with the Santa Tracker Android app and Chromecast.

lock_orientation.description: Game play instruction, asking the user to lock their phone's orientation (prevent rotating the screen).

lt_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
lt_tradition.message: In Lithuania, traditional Christmas ornaments are made out of straws or hay. They're woven into geometric shapes, like stars, snowflakes, or bells. Many families also use straw to decorate the dinner table for a big meal called Kūčios.

meta_description.message: Use Google Santa Tracker to follow Santa Claus on Google Maps as he makes his journey around the world.

mx_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

mx_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
mx_tradition.message: In Mexico, kids of all ages celebrate Christmas by breaking pinatas. Adults and children have fun by wearing a blindfold, spinning around, and swinging a stick to break open the star-shaped hanging pots. When the pinata is smashed open, nuts, fruit and candy spill out for everyone to enjoy.

newtoday.description: Each scene in Santa's village is available by clicking on a building. Buildings are frozen in ice until a specific date. This label indicates a building that is newly available. 10 chars max, and can just say 'New' if that's not enough.

next.description: This is a short label on a button to go to the next step.

next_game.description: This is a short label on a button to go to the next game

nextdecember.description: Message encouraging the user to come back to Santa Tracker in December

nextyear.description: Message encouraging the user to come back to Santa Tracker next year

nonprofit-instruction-coloring.message: Pick an ornament and start coloring.

nonprofit-instruction-share.message: Share your art with your family and friends so they can learn too.

nonprofit-intro-type.description: The introduction to the Season of Giving game. Describes purpose and brief instructions.
nonprofit-intro-type.message: We've partnered with Google.org to showcase five education non-profits that celebrate the season of giving all year long. Scroll down and learn more about how each organization gives back. Show your support by coloring this collection of ornaments and then hanging them on your tree or gifting them to your loved ones.

nonprofit-agastya-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-agastya-description.raw: Agastya brings hands-on science education to children all over rural India. In both their science centers and mobile science vans, they cover everything from the solar system to how the brain works. They have reached over 5 million children and 200,000 teachers across 14 states in India; it’s one of the largest science education programs in the world! Google.org is proud to be a <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://www.google.org/impact-challenge/agastya/"></ph>supporter<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> of Agastya.

nonprofit-agastya-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-code-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-code-description.raw: Code.org® is a non-profit dedicated to expanding access to computer science, and increasing participation by women and underrepresented students of color. Code.org®'s vision is that every student in every school should have the opportunity to learn computer science.

nonprofit-code-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-donorschoose-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-donorschoose-description.raw: Founded in 2000 by a Bronx history teacher, DonorsChoose.org has raised over US$480 million for America's classrooms. Teachers come to DonorsChoose.org to request the materials and experiences they need for their classrooms.

nonprofit-donorschoose-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-enable-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-enable-description.message: According the CDC, 7 in 1000 people experience limb differences and prosthetics are expensive - up to US$10,000! For growing children, the costs can add up quickly. e-Nable is a global community of people who work together to make 3D printed hands for children with limb differences. Google.org is helping the Enable Community Foundation in supporting the e-NABLE Community to design more hands and increase the number of kids who can get hands.

nonprofit-enable-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-jane-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-jane-description.raw: Chimpanzees are human being's closest living relatives in the animal kingdom! Today, there are fewer than 300,000 chimpanzees remaining due to habitat loss, disease and illegal trade. The Jane Goodall Institute (JGI) protects chimpanzees by observing and understanding their behaviors as well as the habitats in which they live. JGI also works to build a community of people who are protecting and conserving wildlife and the environment we share. <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="//www.google.com/maps/about/behind-the-scenes/streetview/treks/gombe-tanzania/"></ph>Explore the Chimpanzee habitats<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> in Gombe, Tanzania.

nonprofit-jane-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-khan-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-khan-description.raw: Khan Academy is a nonprofit with a mission to provide a free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere. Khan Academy believes learners of all ages should have unlimited access to free educational content they can master at their own pace.

nonprofit-khan-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-more-information.description: Is followed by a URL to a nonprofit. This appears in a print-out and the URL is sometimes in a new line, other times to the right. 40 chars max.

nonprofit-nature-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-nature-description.message: The Nature Conservancy works to protect and restore forests in the United States and around the world. These iconic forests sustain life around the planet. They filter water, clean our air, support communities of people and provide habitat for important plant and animal species. At the current rate of deforestation, our forests will be wiped out within 100 years. The Nature Conservancy’s Plant a Billion Trees program is working to plant one billion trees by 2025 and restore the world’s most critical forests.

nonprofit-nature-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-lwb-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-lwb-description.raw: Libraries Without Borders is a leading international NGO in culture-based development founded in 2007, headquartered in Paris. They have built more than 300 libraries around the world.

nonprofit-lwb-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-pratham-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-pratham-description.raw: Close to 40% of the global population does not have access to education in a language they speak or understand. StoryWeaver hopes to change that by helping educators, writers and translators create joyful, supplementary reading resources for children.

nonprofit-pratham-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-rnib-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-rnib-description.message: There are many people in the world who are living with sight loss, but have some remaining vision left. Google.org is helping RNIB develop 'smart glasses' that help people with low vision see shapes and silhouettes more easily. Smart glasses can make the world easier to see, helping people regain their independence and confidence.

nonprofit-rnib-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-solar-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-solar-description.raw: 1.3 billion people have no access to electricity, and many have to use kerosene lamps that burn fuel and pollute homes. Solar lights, however, absorb power from the sun during the day and provide hours of light in the evening without burning or polluting. They help you read, play, and get home safely at night. SolarAid provides access to solar lights to many who need them. Google.org is proud to be a <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://www.google.org/impact-challenge/solaraid/"></ph>supporter<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> of SolarAid.

nonprofit-solar-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-water-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-water-description.raw: We use water for showers and baths, for cooking, and of course, for drinking. Clean water is a precious resource, and many people rely on hand-dug wells to access aquifers, which hold clean water deep in the ground between layers of rock and soil. charity: water works with local partners to build wells and other water projects where they are greatly needed. Google.org is proud to be a <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://www.google.org/global-impact-awards/charity-water/"></ph>supporter<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> of charity: water.

nonprofit-water-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Refers to 'Well' as a noun, defined as a shaft sunk into the ground to obtain water.

nonprofit-wheelmap-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-wheelmap-description.message: It can be difficult for wheelchair users to figure out which places are accessible: Cinemas, Restaurants and wherever else they might travel. Wheelmap shows which places are wheelchair accessible so that wheelchair users can spend less time planning routes and more time exploring the world!

nonprofit-wheelmap-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Refers to a person's ability to be mobile, to move freely and easily.

nonprofit-wwf-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-wwf-description.raw: Climate change continues to disrupt the balance of many of the world’s ecosystems, both warm and cold places. In the Arctic, polar bears are losing their sea ice habitat with rising temperatures, and face added threats from human activities, such as oil and gas development and shipping. World Wildlife Fund works to ensure the survival of the species through scientific research and working in partnership with Arctic native communities. Google.org is proud to be a <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://www.worldwildlife.org/stories/google-helps-wwf-stop-wildlife-crime"></ph> supporter<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> with World Wildlife Fund.

nonprofit-wwf-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-wwh-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-wwh-description.message: Research suggests that 95% of people with hearing loss can be treated with hearing aids, but less than 1% of people in low- and middle-income countries who need hearing aids get them. World Wide Hearing (WWH) connects children to their world by providing hearing aids and services. WWH is designing an affordable, tablet-based hearing loss diagnostic tool for use in the developing world. More people who need hearing aids can therefore receive them.

nonprofit-wwh-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

notice_cookies.description: Notice informing users that this site uses cookies and similar
notice_cookies.message: Google serves cookies to analyse traffic to this site, and to optimize your experience. Information about your use of our site is shared with Google for that purpose.

notice_cookies_details.description: An action or button that allows users to learn more about Santa Tracker's use of cookies

notification.description: Label for a toggle button enabling and disabling notifications

notification_notice.description: Describing what will happen if notifications are enabled
notification_notice.message: Santa's elves will keep you up-to-date with Santa's schedule

notification_prompt.description: Text used on a button that allows users to enable notifications

notification_newtoday.description: Heading used on a notification that tells the user something is new today

notification_newtoday_stop.description: An action that allows the user to stop notifications of this current type (15char max)

np_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

nz_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

nz_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
nz_tradition.message: Because Christmas is in the summer in New Zealand, friends and family gather round a barbecue. Typical Christmas meals include roast lamb, sometimes cooked in a 'hangi' - an underground pit or earth oven. A favorite dessert is pavlova: meringue covered in fresh fruit like strawberries and kiwifruit.

offline_user_message.description: Informing a user that they're using the Santa Tracker website without an internet connection.

offline_available_online.description: Indicates a scene or game is only available while online, with an internet connection.

offline.description: Used as a badge on scenes that are unavailable because the user is offline. Short, concise.

offline_notification.description: A notification sent to users when Santa Tracker is first made available offline. This is presented underneath a "Santa Tracker" heading.
offline_notification.message: Santa's village is now available offline! The elves can also bring you new content throughout December.

offline_notification_nothanks.description: Button text to dismiss a prompt.

okay.description: Button text to say "Okay". Short (<5 chars) is preferred but not required.

om_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

onthego.description: Link text. This will show a map of where Santa is located.

openingtomorrow.description: Each scene in Santa's village is available by clicking on a building. Buildings are frozen in ice until a specific date. This label indicates ice will melt, and the scene will be available tomorrow.

opens.description: Games in Santa's village are only available from a specific date in December. This short string will be placed above a localized day of the month (e.g. '2nd', '15th') showing when the scene will open.

ornament-print-instructions.description: Instructions on how to assemble a printed ornament. This is printed on the same page and refers to a line just below, where the paper should be folded.
ornament-print-instructions.message: Fold here and glue sides together

pause.description: Button text. 15 char limit. Lets a user pause a game.

paused.description: Label text. 15 char limit. A game is paused.

pa_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

pe_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

pg_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

ph_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

ph_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
ph_tradition.message: The Philippines is known for having the world's longest Christmas season. Four months are considered Christmas months: September, October, November, December. Christmas carols can oftentimes be heard as early as the beginning of September.

pl_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

pl_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

play.description: Button text. 15char limit. A label on an activity that will let the user play a game.

playagain.description: When you finish playing a game, we ask you to play again.

playextra.description: When you finish playing a basic game, we ask you to play extra levels.

playdescription.message: Play with friends in the Santa Tracker Android App.

pr_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

practice.description: Label that informs a user that they are in 'practice' mode, and that scores are not counted. Short, <15 chars.

press.description: Menu item for press, aka journalism/media, information.

press-about-village1.message: Santa's Village is celebrating its fifteenth year of fun, educational, and interactive holiday activities. Under Mrs. Claus’s expert guidance, the elves have updated the village with a snazzy look and feel along with some brand new content. And, thanks to a new, hot-cocoa powered heating system, the village will no longer take all of December to thaw—all two dozen activities will be available starting on December 4. Now the elves (and you!) have more time to play and explore in Santa's Village.

press-about-village2.raw: In the village, you can practice basic coding skills, create original artwork, exercise your geographic chops, and learn more about charitable organizations like <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://www.khanacademy.org/"></ph>Khan Academy<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> and <ph name="BEGIN_LINK2"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://code.org/"></ph>Code.org<ph name="END_LINK2"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>. Teachers can even <ph name="BEGIN_LINK3"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="./educators.html"></ph>download lesson plans<ph name="END_LINK3"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> with video guides to help teach their students fundamental coding skills and holiday traditions in English, Spanish, French, Japanese and Korean.

press-about-tracker1.message: On December 24th, we'll launch the Tracker, a dashboard that allows Santa fans to follow his progress as he whips from city to city. You can also see his live location on Google Maps and ask the Google Assistant, "OK Google, Where’s Santa?"—so you can keep a pulse on Santa's whereabouts even when you’re on the go.

press-edu1.raw: We've expanded our <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="./educators.html"></ph>educator resource page<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> to provide teachers with video guides to accompany lesson plans now available in five languages. All of your favorite games remain, introducing basic concepts of coding to global holiday traditions. Google's Santa Tracker encourages holiday learning experiences in a fun way—see <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="./educators.html"></ph>our educational games<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> to learn more.

press-whatsnew1-title.description: Title of a thing that is new, to be used as a prefix of a longer description

press-whatsnew1-text.description: Long description of a thing which is new this year
press-whatsnew1-text.message: Build your own elf from head to toe and make sure it looks elftastic for the many holiday soirées happening on the North Pole.

press-whatsnew2-title.description: Title of a thing that is new, to be used as a prefix of a longer description

press-whatsnew2-text.description: Title of a thing that is new, to be used as a prefix of a longer description
press-whatsnew2-text.raw: If your lifelong dream has been to start a dance troupe with a group of highly talented dancing elves, now’s your chance. Almost. Using a machine learning model called <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://medium.com/tensorflow/real-time-human-pose-estimation-in-the-browser-with-tensorflow-js-7dd0bc881cd5"></ph>PoseNet<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>, you can train an elf to learn your moves so can get your elf on the dance floor.

press-whatsnew3-title.description: Title of a thing that is new, to be used as a prefix of a longer description
press-whatsnew3-title.message: A new way to track Santa:

press-whatsnew3-text.description: Title of a thing that is new, to be used as a prefix of a longer description: note that 'hamburger' refers to the three-line 'more' menu sometimes nicknamed the hamburger menu, and Location Sharing is a feature of Google Maps
press-whatsnew3-text.raw: You'll also be able to see Santa's real time location on Google Maps—just tap on the hamburger button and then on "Location Sharing" to see exactly where Santa is throughout his journey. You can also go to <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://g.co/findsanta"></ph>https://g.co/findsanta<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> for an easy shortcut!

press-whatsnew4-title.description: Title of a thing that is new, to be used as a prefix of a longer description

press-whatsnew4-text.description: Title of a thing that is new, to be used as a prefix of a longer description
press-whatsnew4-text.raw: If you're craving more holiday cheer, check out the Gboard holiday stickers available on <ph name="BEGIN_LINK1"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.inputmethod.latin"></ph>Android<ph name="END_LINK1"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>, <ph name="BEGIN_LINK2"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/gboard-the-google-keyboard/id1091700242?mt=8"></ph>iOS<ph name="END_LINK2"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>, and our <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.santatracker"></ph>Android app<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>. And, enjoy some literary fun by asking the Google Assistant to "Tell me a holiday story" and "Where's Santa?"

press-villagetracker-opendec.description: Title indicating that Santa Tracker is available all December

press-villagetracker-open24th.description: Title indicating that the Tracker itself is open on the 24th

press-device-text.description: Blurb about Santa Tracker being available on phones, Chromecast, Assistant etc
press-device-text.message: The spirit of the holidays is everywhere, including all your devices!

press-need-title.description: Title, in the form of a question, asking if users need more information

press-need-text.description: Blurb about Elves and Googlers available to help. 'Googlers' refers to Google employees, and should likely not be translated.
press-need-text.message: Elves and Googlers are here to help.

press-asset-resources.description: Title for downloadable assets usable by press

press-asset-screenshot.description: Used as a link to a demonstration screenshot of a game

press-asset-animation.description: Used as a link to a demonstration animation of a game

pt_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

py_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

quickdraw-splashview-title.description: Title referring to a robot, named Tensor (who is gender neutral), that wants to do automated image recognition.
quickdraw-splashview-title.message: Help Tensor practice its image recognition!

quickdraw-splashview-description.description: Description about how Tensor (gender neutral) the robot operates, to recognize different objects.
quickdraw-splashview-description.message: Tensor is Santa's Machine Learning robot that helps him quickly decipher the letters he receives from children all over the world. To help Tensor practice, draw a picture of each holiday word on the screen and it will tell you what it sees. The more you draw, the smarter Tensor will get, so let's help Santa be more efficient than ever this holiday season!

quickdraw-slate.description: Action/order/verb. Text that appears above the word to draw.

quickdraw-newround-button.description: Label for a button to click to start a game round

quickdraw-timesup-title-noguess.description: Title of a message on an end of game screen to indicate that the AI didn't recognize any drawings.

quickdraw-timesup-subline-noguess.description: Text shown on an end of game screen when an robot named Tensor didn't recognize any drawings.
quickdraw-timesup-subline-noguess.message: Tensor didn't recognize any of your drawings.

quickdraw-timesup-title-guess.description: Title of a message on an end of game screen, when the AI recognized a drawing.

quickdraw-timesup-subline-guess-one.description: Sentence on end of game screen. When a robot recognized one of a player's drawings.
quickdraw-timesup-subline-guess-one.message: Tensor recognized one of your drawings.

quickdraw-timesup-subline-guess.description: Sentence on end of game screen. When a robot recognized at least two of a player's drawings.

quickdraw-round-no-new-guess.description: Sentence displayed during a game, when a robot isn't able to guess what you are drawing. 30 character limit.
quickdraw-round-no-new-guess.message: I'm not sure what that is.

quickdraw-round-sorry.description: When a robot coudn't guess your drawing, and is sorry about it. 8 character limit.

quickdraw-round-timesup.description: When the timer expires, and a robot didn't guess what you are drawing. 20 character limit.

quickdraw-machine-see.description: 'I see' is followed by a list of guesses. 8 character limit.

quickdraw-machine-or.description: This word separates different guesses in a list of guesses. If there's no suitable word, a comma is OK.

quickdraw-machine-know.description: When the AI finally guessed what the player is drawing. 20 character limit.

quickdraw-rounddetails-title.description: Displays on a end of game screen. Reminds the players what they were asked to draw.

quickdraw-rounddetails-santa-version.description: Displays on a end of game screen. Above the canonical drawing of a thing. (i.e. a beautiful drawing).

quickdraw-rounddetails-also-look.description: Displays on an end of game screen. Show other drawings that looked like the player's drawing. This is shown when the robot recognized your drawing.
quickdraw-rounddetails-also-look.message: Tensor also thought your drawing looked like these:

quickdraw-rounddetails-look-more.description: Displays on an end of game screen. Show other drawings that looked like the player's drawing. This is shown when the robot did not recognize your drawing.
quickdraw-rounddetails-look-more.message: Tensor thought your drawing looked more like these:

quickdraw-rounddetails-how-know.description: A title that asks the question of how Tensor the robot knows what you were drawing.
quickdraw-rounddetails-how-know.raw: How does Tensor know what <ph name="THING"><ex>Mittens</ex>{{thing}}</ph> looks like?

quickdraw-rounddetails-it-learned.description: A title that explains how a robot guessed your drawings.
quickdraw-rounddetails-it-learned.message: It learned by looking at these examples drawn by other people.

readyquestion.description: Short string with an explicit question mark, asking if the user is ready.

ro_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

ru_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

ru_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

ru_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
ru_tradition.message: Russian children decorate a New Year's tree, instead of a Christmas tree. Children wait with longing for Grandfather Frost who travels with his granddaughter Snowmaiden, delivering presents across the land. Grandfather Frost lives deep in the woods in Veliky Ustyug, in northern Russia.

sa_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

santa-app.description: A very short description of Santa Tracker, in English just 'Santa's is fine, to be used on an app launcher icon, e.g. on an Android home screen. Ideally this will be <=12 chars.

santasearch_character_gingerbread_man.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, a gingerbread man.

santasearch_character_mrs_claus.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, the wife of Santa Claus.

santasearch_character_pegman.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, the Google Maps pegman.

santasearch_character_penguin.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, a penguin who lives at the North Pole.

santasearch_character_rudolph.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, Rudolph the Reindeer.

santasearch_character_santa.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, Santa.

santasearch_hint.description: Label for the button to click when searching for a character in the Santa Search game to get a hint of his location. This should preferably be one word.

santasearch_level_beach.description: Name of the Santa Search's game beach level, appears below the level art. Please try to keep this below 20 characters.

santasearch_level_lab.description: Name of the Santa Search's game lab level, appears below the level art. Please try to keep this below 20 characters.

santasearch_level_mountains.description: Name of the Santa Search's game mountains level, appears below the level art. Please try to keep this below 20 characters.

santasearch_level_museum.description: Name of the Santa Search's game museum level, appears below the level art. Please try to keep this below 20 characters.

santasearch_level_select.description: Appears when a level in the Santa Search game has been hovered in the level selection screen. Please keep this below 10 characters.

santasearch_search_for_santa.description: A heading for the level selection screen.

santatracker.description: Product name. The name of the website. Please keep relatively short.

scene_airport.description: Title of a scene/game. Elves are arriving at the "North Pole Airport".

scene_android_cityquiz.description: Name of a game. Player is shown pictures of cities and asked to select the correct location on a map.

scene_android_dancer.description: Name of a game. Dasher is the name of Santa's reindeer. Player can make him dance. The name benefits from rhyming.

scene_android_penguinswim.description: Name of a penguin swimming game

scene_android_presenttoss.description: Name of a game. Player throws presents into a large sack by swiping on the screen.

scene_android_rocketsleigh.description: Name of a game. Player is an elf riding a rocket-powered sleigh.

scene_android_snowballrun.description: Name of a running game where an elf runs from a snowball

scene_app.description: Title of a scene/game. This takes the user to the Santa Android App available on Google Play..

scene_boatload.description: Title of a scene/game. Game to launch presents at targets.

scene_blimp.description: Title of a scene/game. This shows Santa reloading with more presents during his flight.

scene_briefing.description: Title of a scene/game. Mrs. Claus' is giving a briefing on how to deliver presents.

scene_build.description: Title of a scene/game. Work together as elves by moving around in a factory to build presents. 'Bolt' means the verb speedy, or fast.

scene_callfromsanta.description: Title of a scene/game. This lets Santa call your phone number and give a greeting.

scene_citylights.description: Title of a scene/game. Showcases different Street View scenes, containing holiday lights and decorations, from around the world.

scene_clausdraws.description: Title of a scene/game. A drawing game where the player can draw creatively in a Santa-themed environment. In English, this title ryhmes, and 'Claus' refers to 'Santa Claus'.

scene_codeboogie.description: Title of a scene/game. You can teach Santa's Elves how to dance ('boogie') through code.

scene_codelab.description: Title of a scene/game. Instruct an elf to deliver a present through code.

scene_commandcentre.description: Title of a scene/game. Provides insights into the present delivery process: Elves looking at monitors, adjusting knobs, loading presents into bags etc.

scene_dash.description: Title of a scene/game. Help a penguin navigate icebergs to pick up presents.

scene_elfmaker.description: Title of a scene/game. Create an Elf that looks just like you.

scene_elfski.description: Title of a scene/game. Elves ski down a mountain.

scene_factory.description: Title of a scene/game. See how Santa makes candy in a factory.

scene_family.description: Menu item/heading for a page containing resources for families using Santa Tracker, who might be using Santa Tracker with younger people in their charge.

scene_giftmatch.description: Title of a scene/game. Match presents in a gem-matcher style game.

scene_glider.description: Title of a scene/game. Fly as an elf in a paraglider, dropping presents into chimneys.

scene_guides.description: Menu item/heading for a page containing resources for adults, who might be using Santa Tracker with younger people in their charge.

scene_gumball.description: Title of a scene/game. Drop gumballs (round lollies) through a scene, tilting to ensure they reach their destination.

scene_havoc.description: Title of a scene/game. Work together in a frantic/busy/hectic factory environment to build presents.

scene_holidayfoods.description: Title of a scene/game. Explore foods from different countries.
scene_holidayfoods.message: Google Earth Holiday Foods of the World

scene_icecave.description: Title of a scene/game. See Santa deliver presents to a giant snowman who lives in a cave.

scene_island.description: Title of a scene/game. See Santa deliver presents to a tropical island.

scene_jamband.description: Title of a scene/game. Create your own custom band arrangement with Santa's Elves.

scene_jetpack.description: Title of a scene/game. Fly through the air and collect presents while avoiding obstacles.

scene_latlong.description: Title of a scene/game. Find the right places on a map to deliver presents to.

scene_matching.description: Title of a scene/game. Traditional matching game, click doors to see items and try to pair them off.

scene_mercator.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different countries and find their place on the map.

scene_ollieundersea.description: Title of a scene/game. Our Village friends join Ollie the narwhal for a day underwater as they put together the first annual kelp lighting celebration.

scene_playground.description: Title of a scene/game. A Santa-themed playground with see-saws, slides and other play equipment.

scene_poseboogie.description: Title of a scene/game. You can dance Santa's Elves how to dance ('boogie') through making a pose.

scene_postcard.description: Title of a scene/game. Generate postcards and share them with your friends.

scene_presentbounce.description: Title of a scene/game. Create a "Rube Goldberg"-style machine to bounce presents into a bag.

scene_presentdrop.description: Title of a scene/game. Practice dropping presents into practice chimneys.

scene_quickdraw.description: Title of a scene/game. Draw shapes and try to have Santa's robot guess what you are drawing.

scene_racer.description: Title of a scene/game. Race Rudolph through the snow, collecting the most presents along the way.

scene_rollercoaster.description: Title of a scene/game. Elves visiting an icey theme park, riding a rollercoaster.

scene_runner.description: Title of a scene/game. Infinite runner game where you play a generic reindeer and elf companion, collecting presents for as long as you can.

scene_canvas.description: Title of a scene/game. A drawing game where the player (note: you are not playing _as_ Santa) can draw creatively on a canvas, including using stickers and Santa-themed effects.

scene_santasearch.description: Title of a scene/game. A "Where's Wally/Waldo"-style (not affiliated) experience to find Santa in tricky scenes.

scene_santaselfie.description: Title of a scene/game. Give Santa a new hairstyle.

scene_seasonofcaring.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different charities with a disability focus, and paint baubles.

scene_seasonofgiving.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different charities, and paint baubles.

scene_snowball.description: Title of a scene/game. Throw snowballs at fellow elves until only one remains standing up.

scene_snowbox.description: Title of a scene/game. Play with 3D blocks and shapes in a creative environment. This is a pun on 'Sandbox' in English.

scene_snowflake.description: Title of a scene/game. Use coding to create postcards with snowflakes, and share them with your friends.

scene_speedsketch.description: Title of a scene/game. Draw images on a frosted glass window that Santa's helper robot tries to identify.

scene_streetview.description: Title of a scene/game. View a "street view" style enviroment in the downtown North Pole.

scene_storybook.description: Title of a scene/game. Read a Santa-themed storybook that aligns with environmental sustainability.

scene_traditions.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different holiday traditions from around the world.

scene_traditionsquiz.description: Title of a scene/game. Take a nine quastion quiz and learn more about holiday history.

scene_translations.description: Title of a scene/game. Translate common holiday phrases to and from different languages.

scene_trivia.description: Title of a scene/game. Play a trivia game about geography.

scene_undersea.description: Title of a scene/game. See Santa deliver presents underwater.

scene_videoscene_carpool.description: Title of a video scene. Plays a video with elves getting out of a tiny car.

scene_videoscene_comroom.description: Title of a video scene. Shows Santa's command centre.

scene_videoscene_jingle.description: Title of a video scene. Elves singing and dancing.

scene_videoscene_liftoff.description: Title of a video scene. Santa is taking off, launching etc.

scene_videoscene_likealight.description: Title of a video scene. Santa has slept in, and now needs to get ready to go! Elves look after the factory, making sure it's running smoothly and reducing pollution by switching off the lights.

scene_videoscene_museum.description: Title of a video scene. Shows a history of Santa Tracker in a museum, with Santa and the elves as leading stars.

scene_videoscene_office.description: Title of a video scene. An office prank where an elf has his desk covered in wrapping paper.

scene_videoscene_onvacation.description: Title of a video scene. Santa is on vacation in a city before his work in December.

scene_videoscene_penguinproof.description: Title of a video scene. Penguins are trying to discover Santa's password, until he gets a better one.

scene_videoscene_reload.description: Title of a video scene. Santa restocks presents mid-journey.

scene_videoscene_reindeerworries.description: Title of a video scene. Santa is missing from the North Pole, and the reindeers are worried.

scene_videoscene_santasback.description: Title of a video scene. Alternative meaning is 'Santa has returned'.

scene_videoscene_satellite.description: Title of a video scene. Santa encounters a satellite on his journey.

scene_videoscene_selfies.description: Title of a video scene. Elves are looking through camera 'selfies' taken by Santa.

scene_videoscene_slackingoff.description: Title of a video scene. An elf is caught playing video games instead of working.

scene_videoscene_takeoff.description: Title of a video scene. Santa and the reindeer are ready to go, but they need a little hlep from the coding elves before they can go.

scene_videoscene_temptation.description: Title of a video scene. An elf is tempted by a giant red button that rapidly accelerates Santa's sleigh

scene_videoscene_tired.description: Title of a video scene. The reindeers slow down as one is tired and needs a break.

scene_videoscene_wheressanta.description: Title of a video scene. Santa is on vacation on a desert island before his work in December.

scene_videoscene_workshop.description: Title of a video scene. Learn about Santa's workshop, where the elves work and presents are made.

scene_videoscene_yulelog.description: Title of a video scene. Watch a video of a 'Yule Log', a long video of a fireplace burning with holiday-themed ornaments surrounding (see Wikipedia for a good definition).

scene_windtunnel.description: Title of a scene/game. Watch Rudolph's flying skills be tested in a wind tunnel.

scene_wrap.description: Title of a scene/game. Help an elf wrap presents by pressing the right key combinations. This is a pun in English (like "Rap Battle"), but doesn't need to be in other languages.

snowball_waiting.message: Waiting for more of Santa's elves

snowball_remaining.description: Describes the number of players that are still playing a game, out of a total number that started the game. The numbers will both always be two or greater, so plurals are fine.

snowflake_create_message.description: Tell user to design a snowflake.

snowflake_draw_now_repeat_message.description: A snowflake draws its first point slowly, then repeats itself around in a circle for the other 5. This message is shown between drawing points.

snowflake_draw_repeat_message.description: A snowflake draws its first point slowly, then repeats itself around in a circle for the other 5. This message is shown between drawing points.

snowflake_draw_rotating_and_repeating_me.description: A snowflake draws its first point slowly, then repeats itself around in a circle for the other 5. This message is shown between drawing points.

snowflake_share_postcard_message.description: Tell user to make a postcard and share it.
