storybook_paragraph_01.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Aside: Introducing some story background. There are penguins and elves in the story.
storybook_paragraph_01.message: The penguins were sledding. Elves cheered with delight.

storybook_paragraph_02.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Aside: Describing the environment where the story happens, where the holiday tree in Santa's village is about to be 'lit up' with holiday lights (not fire, LED lights etc)
storybook_paragraph_02.message: The whole town was a-buzz for the village tree light.

storybook_paragraph_03.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Aside: Introducing the protagonist whose name is Ollie. And he is feeling sad
storybook_paragraph_03.message: Not everyone that day was feeling so jolly. It was a sad day, you see, for a narwhal named Ollie.

storybook_paragraph_04.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by a character named Ollie who is introduced in the prior line, with a subtle rhyme on 'it' and 'lit' in English.
storybook_paragraph_04.message: “I wish, just this once, I could be there to see it. It seems so amazing to watch that big tree lit.”

storybook_paragraph_05.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Replied by another character called Mary.
storybook_paragraph_05.message: “But you love the ocean!” replied sweet Mary Bear. “All the seashells and plankton. It’s awesome down there!”

storybook_paragraph_06.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the character called Ollie. “blue” here has a double meaning: the color and also the feeling.
storybook_paragraph_06.message: “I guess so,” said Ollie, “that’s certainly true. But sometimes the big blue makes me feel blue, too!”

storybook_paragraph_07.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the character called Mary.
storybook_paragraph_07.message: “Well what if...” said Mary, with an encouraging smile, “I came down there today and we swam for a while?”

storybook_paragraph_08.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the character called Mary, inviting Ollie.
storybook_paragraph_08.message: “Go exploring? Surf sea reefs... Or better yet, I know!”

storybook_paragraph_09.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Suggestions by the character called Mary.
storybook_paragraph_09.message: “We could hold a tree lighting of our very own.”

storybook_paragraph_10.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Aside: Elves, penguins and a few reindeer are joining the party who are planning to visit Ollie under the sea.
storybook_paragraph_10.message: A plan had been hatched. Mary gathered her crew. In jumped elves and then penguins. A few reindeer, too!

storybook_paragraph_11.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. The character named Mary continue inviting Ollie who is the protagonist.
storybook_paragraph_11.message: Ollie smiled in delight at the friends who had come. “Let’s get to it!” said Mary, “this is going to be fun!”

storybook_paragraph_12.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game.
storybook_paragraph_12.message: Now, to throw a great party, the first thing they’d need is a team of great helpers to help them succeed.

storybook_paragraph_13.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by a charactor named Mary the bear (female), asking everybody to join and help.
storybook_paragraph_13.message: “Gather round!” Mary shouted. “We need all your help, to host our very own undersea lighting of kelp.”

storybook_paragraph_14.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Replied by fishes. They are willing to help with the invites.
storybook_paragraph_14.message: The fish sprung into action, spreading word to the guests. “We’ll handle the invites, you handle the rest!”

storybook_paragraph_15.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game.
storybook_paragraph_15.message: Now the elves had experience with this sort of event. They’d need time for their tinkering, and so off they went.

storybook_paragraph_16.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the charactor named Ollie, asking a male crab and a female lobster for decorations help.
storybook_paragraph_16.message: Decorations were next. They knew just who to see. “Mr. Crab and Ms. Lobster, would you help, pretty please?”

storybook_paragraph_17.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by Oysters, they are willing to help.
storybook_paragraph_17.message: The oysters chimed in, “We can help with design! Hang our pearls from the branches. They’ll sparkle and shine.”

storybook_paragraph_18.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Aside: saying the party needs music.
storybook_paragraph_18.message: Every party needs music, tunes with just the right beat, to get everyone grooving, and up on their feet.

storybook_paragraph_19_disused.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the charactor named Ollie, his uncle named Horatio and his friend named Carl can help with the music.
storybook_paragraph_19_disused.message: “My uncle, Horatio, is the best in the biz. And his good friend Carl is a guitar-playing whiz.”

storybook_paragraph_19.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the charactor named Ollie (male), his uncle named Horatio (male) and his friend named Carla (female) can help with the music.
storybook_paragraph_19.message: “My uncle, Horatio, is the best in the biz. And his good friend Carla is a guitar-playing whiz.”

storybook_paragraph_20.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the charactor named Ollie.
storybook_paragraph_20.message: “It’s almost time for the party, so the last thing we’ll need is the perfect kelp bundle for a ceremonial tree.”

storybook_paragraph_21.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Spoken by the charactor named Ollie with an exciting voice.

storybook_paragraph_22.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game.
storybook_paragraph_22.message: Ollie flip-flopped with glee! What a fabulous party this whole night would be.

storybook_paragraph_23.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. A subtle rhyme is on 'swayed' and 'played'.
storybook_paragraph_23.message: Starfish leapt into place, and the ornaments swayed. The jellyfish danced, and the band members played.

storybook_paragraph_24.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game.
storybook_paragraph_24.message: It was all so fantastic, the decor and the sounds. But the best part was when everyone gathered ‘round...

storybook_paragraph_25.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Emphasizing the best part is when everyone gathered round for the lighting of a tree (lighting up an underwater holiday tree with bioluminescent plankton).

storybook_paragraph_26.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game, describing bioluminescent plankton lighting up an underwater holiday tree.
storybook_paragraph_26.message: The moment was here at long last! The plankton lit up. Ollie let out a gasp!

storybook_paragraph_27.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Describing the peaceful environment of the town with a rhyme on 'aglow' and 'show'.
storybook_paragraph_27.message: It was almost like magic, lights shimmered aglow. The whole town fell silent, just watching the show.

storybook_paragraph_28.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game.
storybook_paragraph_28.message: The most spectacular thing that they’d all ever seen. Lights went yellow, then purple, then bright emerald green.

storybook_paragraph_29.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game.
storybook_paragraph_29.message: Mary started to get sleepy, it was past time for bed, But before they all left, Ollie turned and then said,

storybook_paragraph_30.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Said by the charactor named Ollie to a charactor named Mary.
storybook_paragraph_30.message: “Thank you so much for bringing this whole town together, for a night that I know we’ll remember forever.”

storybook_paragraph_31.description: Paragraph text that appears on a storytelling game. Shown as large text describing the end of a story.

storybook_new_language.description: Paragraph text that appears at the end of a storytelling game. Prompts the user to select a new language to read the story in.
storybook_new_language.message: Love reading about Ollie's adventure? Try exploring in a new language.

tracker_arriving_in.description: Heading that displays how long till Santa arrives

tracker_current_stop.description: Heading above the current stop for Santa

tracker_departing_in.description: Heading that displays how long till Santa departs

tracker_distance_from_you.description: Heading above a number that displays how far Santa is from your location

tracker_distance_travelled.description: Heading above a number that displays how far Santa has travelled sofar on his journey.

tracker_feed.description: Heading describing a live feed, e.g. a social media stream or 'real time updates', about Santa's journey.

tracker_just_in.description: Heading describing up-to-date information from a news source.

tracker_stats.description: Heading describing general information about Santa's location. In English, 'stats' is short for Statistics. Keep short, <25 chars.

tracker_time_from_you_one.description: Describes how far Santa is from your location, in terms of time, when he is very close to you

tracker_flight_nearby.description: Notice that Santa is nearby and that he's able to be tracked
tracker_flight_nearby.message: Santa is nearby, find out where

tracker_flight_start.description: Notice message that Santa has taken off and that he's able to be followed
tracker_flight_start.message: Santa has departed from the North Pole, and you can now follow his route

tracker_gifts_delivered.description: Heading where the number of gifts delivered so far is displayed below

tracker_intro_skip_intro.description: Text on the skip intro button, which hides the Tracker intro.

tracker_intro_user_location.description: Text before the name of the user's current location.

tracker_next_stop.description: Heading above the next stop for Santa

tracker_see_route.description: Text underneath button in the tracker menu to show Santa's route. Please keep this short.

tracker_track.description: Menu item, an imperative action for a user to use the Tracker part of Santa Tracker.

tracker_travelogue.description: Heading above a list of cities that Santa has recently visited. Like a log book or history of Santa's visits.

tracker_your_location.description: Heading where the location of the user is displayed below

traditions-next.description: Button text. Please keep short. User can move through a set of cards describing local traditions of a country.

traditions-world.description: Button text. Please keep short. Used to change a map from a zoomed in view of a country, to a view of the whole world.

tw_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

tz_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

ug_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

underconstruction.description: A label which indicates that Santa's Village is under construction. The site is available but many features are unavailable because it's not yet December.

unmute.description: Button text. 15 char limit. Lets a user unmute sounds, to hear audio again.

uk_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

uk_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
uk_tradition.message: In the United Kingdom, merrymakers of all ages enjoy Christmas crackers on the table at dinner. Crackers are tubes wrapped in colorful paper, with pull tabs on each end. When you pull the tabs, the tube bursts with a loud snap! Inside are paper hats, toys, jokes and prizes to enjoy during Christmas night.

unlocks.description: Games in Santa's village are locked and made available on a specific date within December. This short string will be placed above a localized day of the month (e.g. '2nd', '15th') showing when the scene will be unlocked.

upgrade-warning.description: An error message. Error appears as the sole text on an HTML page.
upgrade-warning.message: Oops! Santa Tracker isn't supported in your browser or you have JavaScript disabled. To access Santa Tracker, download a modern browser or enable JavaScript.

us_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

us_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
us_tradition.message: In the United States, stockings are hung on Christmas Eve. The legend goes that St Nicholas heard of a family in need. To surprise them, he climbed down their chimney and placed precious bags of gold in hanging stockings. From this point, St Nicholas was known as Santa Claus, giver of gifts.

uy_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

uz_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

ve_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

village_comeback.description: Callout to ask users to come back later
village_comeback.message: Come back on the 24th and help us track Santa all night!

village_explore.description: The intro blurb for Santa's Village, can be medium-sized
village_explore.message: Explore, play and learn with Santa's elves all December long

village_get_the_app.description: Menu item indicating that a user should get the Santa Android app from the Google Play Store.
village_get_the_app.message: Get the Santa Tracker App for Android

village_more.description: Menu item to find more ways to learn, play, explore etc about Santa.

village_santa_install.description: Menu item that allows users to install Santa Tracker. Short and does not imply platform (web/Android etc).

village_santa_intall_ios.description: Action that a user can take on iOS to install Santa Tracker to their device. If possible, the translation of 'Add to Home Screen' should match the option available under the 'Share' button (which is an icon) within Safari on an iOS device. Also please do not translate - it is replaced with the 'Share' button that a user must tap.
village_santa_intall_ios.raw: Just tap <span></span> then 'Add to Home Screen'

village_santa_a2hs.description: Menu item that allows users to add the Santa Tracker site as an app icon to the home screen of a mobile device.

village_santa_a2hs_chromeos.description: Menu item for adding Santa Tracker to the shelf of a Chrome OS device.

village_santa_a2hs_desktop.description: Menu item for adding Santa Tracker to the desktop, as an application on a user's computer.

village_santa_cardboard.description: Menu item for finding Santa as part of an app which supports Google Cardboard (Google's Virtual Reality experience). Don't translate 'Cardboard'.

village_santa_cast.description: Menu item for finding Santa on the Google Cast platform. Don't translate 'Google Cast'.

village_santa_crx.description: Menu item for adding Santa as a Google Chrome extension. Don't translate "Chrome".

village_santa_earth_quiz.description: Menu item for playing a quiz with Santa

village_assistant-holiday_story.description: Menu item linking to information about listening to a story with the Google Assistant

village_assistant-call_santa.description: Menu item linking to information about calling Santa with the Assistant

village_assistant-wheres_santa.description: Menu item linking to information about finding out where Santa is with the Assistant

village_takesoff.description: Message describing when Santa Takes off, will be followed by a countdown

vn_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

watch.description: Button text. 15char limit. A label on an activity that will show the user a video.

watch-video.description: Button text. 20char limit. Allows a user to watch a video.

ye_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

yourbest.description: A label placed next to a user's previous best score in a game, so they know what score to beat.

zh-CN_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

zh-TW_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

zm_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

zw_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a geography game.

wrapbattle_combo.description: A message to show when the player has successfully completed a combo

wrapbattle_feedback_miss.description: A message to show when the player has missed a key

wrapbattle_feedback_okay.description: A message to show when the player has barely hit the key

wrapbattle_feedback_good.description: A message to show when the player has hit the key pretty accurately

wrapbattle_feedback_perfect.description: A message to show when the player has hit the key perfectly

elf_choose_body.description: Asks the player to choose a body type for a game where you design yourself as one of Santa's elves

dec24th.description: The date of December 24 (please do not use -th suffixes etc). Used as a subtitle indicating that you can track Santa from this date.

decmonth.description: A short version of 'December', the month. Ideally three characters, but could be 4-5 if need be. Placed before a number indicating the date within December something opens.

decmonth_long.description: 'December', the month. Any length is fine. Placed before a number indicating the date within December something opens.
